subject: Callout support for SBE when watchdog times out
commitMessage:
Callout support for SBE when watchdog times out

This commit provides additional callout support for SBE when the
host does not respond within watchdog timeout interval during SBE
boot window.

Testing:
Steps used:
 1. obmcutil poweroff
 2. istep -s0
 3. systemctl start org.open_power.Dump.Manager.service
 4. systemctl start openpower-debug-collector-watchdog@0.service
 5. Check the journal log, and get the PEL id to print PEL info

PEL info:
    "Callout Section": {
        "Callout Count":        "2",
        "Callouts": [{
            "FRU Type":         "Maintenance Procedure Required",
            "Priority":         "Mandatory, replace all with this type
as a unit",
            "Procedure":        "BMC0002"
        }, {
            "FRU Type":         "Normal Hardware FRU",
            "Priority":         "Medium Priority",
            "Location Code":    "xxxxxxxxxxxxx",
            "Part Number":      "xxxxx",
            "CCIN":             "xxxx",
            "Serial Number":    "xxxxxxx"
        }
...
"User Data 2": {
    "Section Version": "1",
    "Sub-section type": "1",
    "Created by": "0x2000",
    "Data": [
        {
            "Priority": "H",
            "Procedure": "BMC0002"
        },
        {
            "Deconfigured": false,
            "Guarded": false,
            "LocationCode": "Ufcs-xx-xxx",
            "Priority": "M"
        }
    ]
}

Signed-off-by: Shantappa Teekappanavar <sbteeks@yahoo.com>
Change-Id: I5e182cb415a807d97c98812a6713905d39fdbc9a

remove functions throwing exceptions. Avoid exception from  destructor
Looks like this file support only to handle json callout data , please update the comments accordingly.

Better way is to move createPel out of try catch block. Limitaion with ths approch is you need to ffdcFile and unique pointe other wise d-bus call is going to fail. you can refer openpower-proc-control code implementation.
Jayanth, any reason this isn't handled in the call to dump when watchdog says it's an SBE dump needed? This seems like a lot of (duplicated) code for just one error log.

Most of the code added is repository specific common code used to add additional callout part, . Major code is tempory file managment, which is commonly used in all the repos. This is sort of workaround added till the ebe_extrct_rc based hw callout is in.
I'm not a big fan of a source file called "temporary_file". I think I'd just prefer this be in a utils.cpp or something more generic where stuff like this can go.
Forgot add updated meson.build in the previous patch set
as these files are copied from other repo ignore the comments.

why create three different private methods, why can't the code be here in one place. we create private methods if code is used in multiple places, here do not see the case.

or else every thing can be moved to constructor too
this code can be simply placed in destructor, why create another private method. People will assume that this method will be used in multiple places.
not used in this file, please check other header files too
Removed server.hpp include file from other header files, but we need this one. Removing this results into error, so keeping this one here.

not used in this header file
These are used at several places where we create a PEL object. Keeping these two typedefs are related to FFDC. No change.
do not see this being used
Used in ffdc_file.cpp, moved this there along with phosphor-logging/log.hpp include file.
return value of close is ignored
We do nothing if close fails, so just prefixing with (void)

TemporaryFile class is used to manage temp file. A unique temp file is created here, and is deleted once we are done collecting callout data. This is something that was done in attn handler openpower-hw-diags. It looks good to me the way it is now...
Probably doesn't help in any debugging, so I think it is OK not to log a trace...
